|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = <!-- Size of flash --> |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- 3400,3333,3300,3200,3100,3000,2800,2666,2600,2400,2133,2000,1866,1600,1066,1333,800 --> |ram1size = <!-- Size of RAM --> |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips -->

|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none -->

}}{{TIDTOC|switch}} ==Overview== [https://web.archive.org/web/20101203065658/http://www.3com.com/products/en_US/detail.jsp?tab=features&pathtype=purchase&sku=3C1670800C Product page (via archive.org)]
Accton / Arcadyan manufacture is likely
At least one other iteration of the 'Gigabit Switch 8' line exists, specifically, the [https://web.archive.org/web/20061016204101/http://www.3com.com/products/en_US/detail.jsp?tab=features&pathtype=purchase&sku=3C1670800A 3C1670800A].
